title: techno style typewriter
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130526025840im_/http:/typophile.com/files/popercofr-alphanum-opt_4938.png)

any similar enough font will do
author: elihpopyt

comments.content:
It reminds me of an old dot matrix printer I had.. (something like "STAR XXX").  
You can try **[Screener Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20130526025840/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/screener/)** by Patrick Griffin (Canada Type, 2006) or maybe **[Telidon](http://web.archive.org/web/20130526025840/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Typodermic&ffam=Telidon%20Hv%20-%20Regular&fid=6d2a14fc5a7a04f51a9ef28cc2b6df11&fsize=60&text=ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ%2001234567890&wrap=2)** by Ray Larabie (Typodermic, 2001) if you want the dots to be visible ;)

------------------  
I found them using "Find my Font": [http://www.findmyfont.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20130526025840/http:/www.findmyfont.com/ "http://www.findmyfont.com")

Screener is a pretty good match except for the "N" and the digits.  
Thanks for having mentioned findmyfont, it does a much better job than whatthefont.
